comments.creator: taras.mozilla@glek.net
comments.text: Currently d3d initializes on a timer before UI is shown. It show always initialized after UI is shown. Eg. can trigger the timer from xul-window-visible observer notification.
comments.author: taras.mozilla@glek.net
comments.raw_text: Currently d3d initializes on a timer before UI is shown. It show always initialized after UI is shown. Eg. can trigger the timer from xul-window-visible observer notification.

comments.text: If waiting for the windown to show, why would we need a timer at all?
comments.creator: respindola@unverified.tld
comments.author: respindola@unverified.tld
comments.raw_text: If waiting for the windown to show, why would we need a timer at all?
Fwiw, I've put together a rough list of nsITimer launched during startup, cf bug #692420.
